intro: Clermontia micrantha, commonly known as the Kona bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of rainforests, often on rocky or wooded slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, soft pubescence. Clermontia micrantha is known for its delicate appearance and is considered an endemic species, found only in specific regions of Hawaii.
